techStack.title: Tech Stack I have relevant experience with

description: I am a 3rd-year student at ESAIP, aspiring to become a Software Engineer.
I am a Full Stack developer, with two years of experience in web development.

reports.description: All these reports were written in LaTeX, documenting my learning journey in various technical areas.

ai.title: Introduction to AI
ai.description: As a complete beginner in AI at that time, I researched and summarized everything I could find to understand the basics. This report reflects my journey from knowing nothing to grasping fundamental concepts.

trigonometry.title: Trigonometric Formulas Demonstration
trigonometry.description: During my first year in English preparatory class, I wanted to understand where trigonometric formulas came from. I combined various YouTube demonstrations and online resources to create this comprehensive proof guide.

latvia.title: Latvia Summer School Guide
latvia.description: After my first study abroad experience, I created this guide for other ESAIP students. It covers everything from what to pack to how to prepare, helping future students feel more confident about their trip.

network.title: Network Beginner Guide
network.description: When I started learning networking, I created this guide to remember key concepts. It includes a custom script I developed for IP calculations and subnet mask computations available on GitHub.

aomail.title: Aomail
aomail.description: AI-powered email automation platform for smart categorization and management.
aomail.advancedDescription: Aomail is a web application designed to help users manage their emails more efficiently with the support of AI. In this project, I contributed to multiple aspects of the software development process.
tasks: Developed landing page and main web application
Implemented OAuth2.0 for Gmail & Outlook integration
Built admin dashboard for analytics and user management
Created a blog website for SEO
details: Completely refactored landing page using Svelte, focusing on performance optimization and responsive design principles.
Successfully implemented OAuth2.0 integration for Gmail & Outlook, passing security audits by TAC Security and Google's verification process.
Developed an advanced email categorization system using LLM workflows, enabling customizable sorting based on user preferences and behavior.
Implemented real-time email notifications through webhooks for Gmail & Outlook, integrated Stripe payment processing, and optimized email loading with efficient lazy loading techniques.
Implemented comprehensive multilingual support using i18n, with full French language translations throughout the application.
Built an SEO-optimized information website using Spring Boot and PostgreSQL, implementing GA4 tracking and secure deployment practices.
Created an analytics dashboard displaying cost metrics, token usage statistics, and user management capabilities.

server.title: Minecraft Server + Backup Server
server.description: Self-hosted Minecraft server and automated backup system for personal files.
server.advancedDescription: I wanted to have a local backup system as I do not want to learn the importance of a backup the hard way. I also made a Minecraft server to play with my brothers and friends.
tasks: Configured local Minecraft server with proper networking setup
Implemented SSH-based remote management system
Developed automated backup solution with encryption
details: Repurposed an old PC into a local server for hosting and backups.
Configured a headless server with static IP addressing through DHCP for reliable remote access.
Configured secure port forwarding and firewall rules to protect external Minecraft connections.
Established automated disk mounting on startup and normal start-up after power outage for reliable headless operation.
Implemented a robust encrypted backup system using Duplicati for secure file protection.

pcBuilding.title: PC Building
pcBuilding.description: Building gaming PCs for myself and friends.
pcBuilding.advancedDescription: I have been building Gaming PCs since I was 15 with my own computer. I have been interested in understanding how a computer works since. I am always focused on the best performance/cost ratio.
tasks: Component selection and compatibility verification
Assembly and cable management
Performance testing benchmark
OS + Software installation
details: Looking for the best value by comparing prices of new and used components.
Ensuring all parts are compatible to avoid issues during assembly.
Testing performance using simple benchmarking tools and games.
Organizing cables neatly and setting up good airflow for better cooling.
Building PCs based on what the person needs, like gaming or everyday use.

laBrotique.title: La Bro'tique
laBrotique.description: Side business on Vinted with a €15k turnover.
laBrotique.advancedDescription: My first company, which I started with my brother. I used to play Pokémon on my Nintendo 3DS a lot when I was a kid. I enjoy selling used products in good condition that offer great deals for both the buyer and the seller.
tasks: Reverse engineering of the Vinted API
Automated sales management through an app
Customer service and logistics
Achieved over 400 sales and a turnover of €15,000
details: Founded a reselling business specializing in Nintendo consoles and accessories.
Repaired and refurbished consoles, creating value-added bundles with accessories.
Always prioritized customer satisfaction and offered refunds when necessary.
Achieved consistent monthly sales for 10 consecutive months.

tasks: Learned VLANs, switches, and RAID methods
Performed Wi-Fi site analysis using NetSpot
Deployed and configured computers on-site
Explored reverse engineering concepts
Deployed workstations on-site
Created PowerShell software deployment scripts
Migrated switches from PRTG to SolarWinds
Updated switch monitoring maps
Integrated APIs between front-end and back-end
Converted Figma designs into React components
Implemented R&D computation in backend
Worked on Cognitive Screening

courses: Implementation of basic graphs in Python
Intro to data structures and OOP
